intro: Seychellaria barbata, commonly known as the hairy seychellaria, is a flowering plant native to the Seychelles. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive hairy foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat. Seychellaria barbata is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its unique appearance. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
